channel.title: BBC Sport
channel.copyright: Copyright: (C) British Broadcasting Corporation, see https://www.bbc.co.uk/usingthebbc/terms-of-use/#15metadataandrssfeeds for terms and conditions of reuse.

item.title: Inside Postecoglou's 39 days to forget at Forest
item.description: Ange Postecoglou had only just moved into his new flat when he was sacked by Nottingham Forest, ending one of the shortest reigns in Premier League history.

item.title: Chelsea beat Forest to end Postecoglou's time at City Ground
item.description: Chelsea score three second-half goals to beat Nottingham Forest at the City Ground and trigger the sacking of manager Ange Postecoglou just 17 minutes after the game ends.

item.title: Mateta hat-trick earns Palace draw in thriller against Bournemouth
item.description: Jean-Philippe Mateta scores a hat-trick as Crystal Palace fight back from two goals down to draw 3-3 with Bournemouth in a thrilling game at Selhurst Park.

item.title: Trossard sends Arsenal top with win at Fulham
item.description: Leandro Trossard scores in the second half to give Arsenal a 1-0 win over Fulham and send them back to the top of the Premier League.

item.title: Haaland fires Man City to victory against Everton
item.description: Erling Haaland scores twice as Manchester City beat Everton to move up to second in the table.

item.title: Welbeck scores twice to give Brighton late win against Newcastle
item.description: Danny Welbeck secures Brighton a win 2-1 against Newcastle after opening the scoring in the first half and cancelling out a late equaliser from Nick Woltemade in the second.

item.title: Tchaouna scores sensational goal as Burnley beat Leeds
item.description: Loum Tchaouna's brilliant second-half goal helps Burnley beat Leeds United 2-0 to end their five-match winless run in the Premier League.

item.title: Sunderland condemn Wolves to another defeat
item.description: A first Sunderland goal for Nordi Mukiele and an own goal from Ladislav Krejci's condemn Wolves to a sixth defeat from eight matches.

item.title: 'Looks superhuman' - but Man City can't just rely on Haaland
item.description: Erling Haaland is getting so good he is starting to break his own records, following a double for Manchester City against Everton on Saturday.

item.title: Different coach, same Rangers? - Smith questions mentality
item.description: Interim head coach Steven Smith questions Rangers' mentality and habits after the Ibrox side's draw with Dundee United.

item.title: Dyche and Mancini contenders after Forest sack Postecoglou
item.description: Ange Postecoglou is sacked by Nottingham Forest after a 3-0 defeat by Chelsea just 39 days after being appointed as head coach.

item.title: Sunderland bucking the trend, but how bad is it for Wolves?
item.description: Sunderland have made their joint-best start to a Premier League season following victory at the Stadium of Light, but can Wolves stop the rot?

item.title: Chelsea lead race to sign Rogers - Sunday's gossip
item.description: Chelsea lead the race to sign Morgan Rogers, Real Madrid are eyeing Marc Guehi, several Premier League clubs are interested in Argentine teenager Ian Subiabre, plus more.

item.title: Better with age? Welbeck proving pivotal for Brighton
item.description: Danny Welbeck may turn 35 next month, but the Brighton striker does not look like a player entering his twilight years following his double against Newcastle.

item.title: Potter set to accept job as Sweden manager
item.description: Former West Ham manager Graham Potter is set to accept the job as Sweden head coach.

item.title: Players must take responsibility for Postecoglou sacking - Yates
item.description: Nottingham Forest's Ryan Yates says the players need to take "massive responsibility" for manager Ange Postecoglou being sacked after 39 days in charge.

item.title: Missing Trent? Why it's going wrong for Salah and Liverpool
item.description: The Football Focus team looks at why Mohamed Salah is struggling for Liverpool this season, ahead of Manchester United's visit to Anfield

item.title: A long-range stunner and Rolfo's first for Man Utd - WCL goals of the week
item.description: Chelsea's Johanna Rytting Kaneryd and Manchester United's Fridolina Rolfo shine in week two of the league phase of the Women's Champions League.

item.title: Man City can't just rely on Haaland - Guardiola
item.description: Manchester City boss Pep Guardiola says his side can't just rely on "key-man" Erling Haaland after he scored twice in five second-half minutes to beat Everton at the Etihad Stadium.

item.title: Iraola 'angry & upset' with late penalty decision
item.description: Bournemouth boss Andoni Iraola says he "cannot accept" the decision to award Crystal Palace a penalty in the 96th minute, as Bafode Diakite was ruled to have brought Marc Guehi down in the box during a corner in a 3-3 draw at Selhurst Park in the Premier League.

item.title: Villa told stewards they could miss Maccabi Tel Aviv game
item.description: Aston Villa told matchday stewards they did not have to work at the club's fixture against Maccabi Tel Aviv next month, saying they understood some "may have concerns".

item.title: Oviedo and Espanyol players stand still in protest
item.description: Oviedo and Espanyol players refuse to move for the first 15 seconds of their match on Friday as the teams stage a protest at La Liga's decision to host Villarreal against Barcelona in Miami.

item.title: 'Managing a lot of Premier League teams like a holiday compared to Celtic'
item.description: Brendan Rodgers sits down with Kelly Somers to discuss his managerial career, proudest moment and joining the 1,000 club.

item.title: Guehi will leave Palace next year - Glasner
item.description: Captain Marc Guehi has told Crystal Palace he wants to "make something different", says manager Oliver Glasner.

item.title: 'Super Sam' - the Englishman battling Messi for Golden Boot
item.description: 'Super' Sam Surridge has already scored the winner in the US Open Cup final, now he's battling Lionel Messi for the MLS Golden Boot.

item.title: I can't bank on three years at Man Utd - Amorim
item.description: Manchester United head coach Ruben Amorim thinks it is important Sir Jim Ratcliffe went public with his long-term thoughts - but says nothing is certain in football.

item.title: 'Dangerous' Mateta could have scored five - Glasner
item.description: Oliver Glasner says Jean-Philippe Mateta showed his "confidence" and his ability to "deal with pressure", as the French striker sealed his hat-trick with a 97th minute penalty to rescue a 3-3 draw for Crystal Palace against Bournemouth at Selhurst Park in the Premier League.

item.title: Managing player minutes a bigger issue this season - Maresca
item.description: Chelsea manager Enzo Maresca says managing player minutes has been a bigger issue this season because of injuries and praises Josh Acheampong for playing with "personality" after his side beat Nottingham Forest 3-0 at The City Ground.

item.title: Le Bris praises Mukiele's energy as Sunderland beat Wolves
item.description: Sunderland manager Regis Le Bris is pleased with his sides performance, especially Mukiele's providing "brilliant" energy and commitment going forward, scoring early on for Sunderland, resulting in a 2-0 win against Wolves at the Stadium of Light.

item.title: Arsenal need to 'optimise' set-pieces - Arteta
item.description: Arsenal boss Mikel Arteta says his side may have conceded chances due to players being tired after coming back from the international break but was very happy to come away with a 1-0 win over Fulham at Craven Cottage.

item.title: Everton put on a 'good show' and 'challenged' Man City - Moyes
item.description: Everton boss David Moyes says his side put on a "really good show" and "challenged" Manchester City despite losing 2-0 in the Premier League at the Etihad Stadium.

item.title: Parker 'immensely proud' of Burnley win over Leeds
item.description: Scott Parker says "the performance was everything" as Burnley beat Leeds 2-0 to move out of the relegation zone.

item.title: Leeds were better side but not clinical enough - Farke
item.description: Leeds manager Daniel Farke says they were "by far the better side" during a 2-0 defeat by Burnley but fell short in decisive moments.

item.title: Pereira rues Wolves missed chances
item.description: Vitor Pereira says a "stop-start" first half and his side's over reliance on long balls in the second half meant Wolves "stopped playing" in their 2-0 defeat by Sunderland in the Premier League at the Stadium of Light

item.title: More pressure at Celtic than some Premier League clubs - Rodgers
item.description: Celtic manager Brendan Rodgers sits down with Kelly Somers for The Football Interview to discuss his career and the challenges he has faced along the way.

item.title: Passionate Postecoglou defends his managerial legacy
item.description: Nottingham Forest head coach Ange Postecoglou talks about his disappointment at being perceived as a failure at both his current and former clubs, amid rumours that he is already under pressure at Forest after no wins in his first seven games in charge.

item.title: Doekhi scores double as Union Berlin beat Borussia Monchengladbach
item.description: An early double from Danilho Doekhi helps Union Berlin on their way to a 3-1 victory over Borussia Monchengladbach, who remain winless in the Bundesliga.

item.title: Standard-Antwerp abandoned after cup hits referee
item.description: Standard Liege's match against Royal Antwerp will be concluded on Monday behind closed doors after being abandoned in the 87th minute.

item.title: Good feet for a big man? Why Woltemade is no 'tall camel'
item.description: Nick Woltemade has become used to proving people wrong, but what makes the Newcastle striker such a unique talent?

item.title: 'Around 900 EFL players abused online last season'
item.description: The EFL says 'approximately 900 individual players were subjected to online abuse' at some point last season.

item.title: Hundreds attend ex-Liverpool manager Beard's funeral
item.description: The great and good of women's football are among those saying an emotional farewell to Matt Beard.

item.title: 'If it's Muscat, Celtic will be ready' - Rodgers
item.description: Celtic manager Brendan Rodgers is ready for the challenge Kevin Muscat would bring if the former Australia defender is appointed as the new Rangers boss.

item.title: Salford sign ex-Premier League striker Borini
item.description: Former Liverpool and Sunderland striker Fabio Borini joins League Two club Salford City on a contract until January.

item.title: Football, fashion & the rise of the replica shirt
item.description: How football shirts have evolved from one kit per club per season, with simple designs, to fashion statements.

item.title: 'Shout out to my ex' - why clubs are turning to former bosses
item.description: With three clubs bringing back old bosses this season already, BBC Sport looks at the teams and managers who have got back together.

item.title: Why Caicedo is pivotal for Chelsea - but are they over-reliant?
item.description: The 23-year-old midfielder has three goals this season, including his powerful strike against Liverpool, entering the debate as being among the best in the league.

item.title: Which teams have qualified for the World Cup and who is on the brink?
item.description: BBC Sport's Ask Me Anything team looks at who has qualified for next year's Fifa World Cup.

item.title: 'Another celebrity boss? No, I've earned my chance'
item.description: Forest Green boss Robbie Savage insists he is no "celebrity manager" after guiding his new side to a dream start, including a spot in the FA Cup first round.

item.title: Transfers - September to December 2025
item.description: Check out the significant signings and departures in the Premier League, Scottish Premiership, EFL and Women's Super League.

item.title: Manager ins and outs - 2025-26 season
item.description: BBC Sport tracks all the manager ins and outs in the Premier League, Scottish Premiership, Women's Super League, English Football League and National League.

item.title: What does squad-cost ratio and anchoring mean in football?
item.description: Our Ask Me Anything team explain what squad-cost ratio and anchoring mean.

item.title: Why do Australia play in Asia and not Oceania?
item.description: BBC Sport's Ask Me Anything team explains why the Socceroos play in the Asian Football Confederation and the Asian Cup.

item.title: When is the FA Cup first round?
item.description: Our Ask Me Anything team explains when the FA Cup first-round takes place and what the fixtures are.

item.title: What is '007' in football?
item.description: Our Ask Me Anything Team look at what the tagline of '007' means and where the taunt came from.

item.title: Why are some football shin pads so small?
item.description: Our Ask Me Anything team explore why some football shin pads are so small, and what the laws are around wearing them.

item.title: Klidje shines for Hibs - can record signing kick on?
item.description: BBC Sport Scotland examines whether Thibault Klidje's breakout performance against Livingston is the springboard for Hibernian's record signing to kick on.

item.title: How have the best team to watch in Scotland only won one game?
item.description: Motherwell are playing their best football in years - and arguably are the best to watch in Scotland right now - so how come they have only won once so far in the Scottish Premiership?

item.title: Top European clubs discuss using six substitutes
item.description: Europe's top clubs, including some Premier League sides, have held discussions about using six substitutes per game to ease the workload on players.

item.title: Barcelona's Lewandowski could miss El Clasico
item.description: Striker Robert Lewandowski has a hamstring injury and could miss Barcelona's game against Real Madrid later this month.

item.title: Overseas game a 'sacrifice' for 'survival' of Serie A - Como
item.description: Italian club Como say "sacrifice is essential" to ensure the "survival" of Serie A amid the financial dominance of the Premier League as they press ahead with plans to play AC Milan in Perth, Australia.

item.title: Three players, 57 goals - who is the best striker?
item.description: BBC Sport looks at the goalscoring exploits of Harry Kane, Kylian Mbappe and Erling Haaland, who are all averaging more than a goal a game.

item.title: 'He's giving us a lot of joy' - Rashford's revival at Barcelona
item.description: Marcus Rashford came to Barcelona to revive a spluttering career, and so far he is making a good job of that task, but it remains early days in Spain for the England forward.

item.title: How McTominay became a 'brother of Naples'
item.description: Scotland midfielder Scott McTominay reflects on his brilliant first season at Napoli, where he wants to keep giving his "absolute best".

item.title: 'I'm fully all in with Bayern' - Kane cools on Premier League return
item.description: Harry Kane says his interest in returning to the Premier League has cooled and he is willing to open talks with Bayern Munich over a new contract.

item.title: Arsenal goalkeeper Zinsberger suffers ACL injury
item.description: Arsenal goalkeeper Manuela Zinsberger is expected to miss the rest of the season after suffering a ruptured anterior cruciate ligament (ACL) injury.

item.title: Northern Ireland captain Magill out of play-off
item.description: Northern Ireland captain Simone Magill is one of several absentees for the Nations League promotion play-off with Iceland.

item.title: Agyemang joins Premier League stars on Golden award shortlists
item.description: England striker Michelle Agyemang is nominated for Golden Girl, while nine Premier League players are named on the shortlist for the Golden Boy award.

item.title: From farming village to Liverpool icon - the Salah story
item.description: BBC Sport visits Egypt to discover what Mohamed Salah means to the people of the football-mad country, and how a small boy from humble beginnings became a national icon.

item.title: Napoli 'smell blood' & target Premier League's discarded stars
item.description: After Scott McTominay was a hit, Napoli went back to the Premier League for Kevin de Bruyne, could more players follow them to Serie A?

item.title: How does Daniel Levy run Tottenham - and would he ever leave?
item.description: With Tottenham struggling on the pitch and chairman Daniel Levy facing criticism from fans, BBC Sport looks at how the club is run and what the future might hold.

item.title: When River Plate icon Diaz took over fourth-tier Oxford
item.description: Twenty years on from Ramon Diaz's surprising appointment at Oxford United, BBC Sport looks at what happened and how it went.

item.title: East meets west London - the mentor who changed Chelsea
item.description: Vinay Menon knew nothing about football when he went for a meeting at a west London mansion in 2009. A few weeks later he was in the heart of the Chelsea dressing room.

item.title: The air crash and the underdogs - a triumph for a lost generation
item.description: Nineteen years and 10 miles separated Zambia's football team from a lost, golden generation on a fateful night in Libreville.

item.title: The rise and fall of North Korea - the sleeping giant of women's football
item.description: North Korea lags behind most of the rest of the world in several areas. But the hermit state has had an outsized impact on international women's football.
